task.title: Create a Deliverable in Oxygen Content Fusion
task.shortdesc: How to turn your content into a deliverable using GitHub, Netlify, and Oxygen Content Fusion

context.p: Once you’ve connected GitHub and Oxygen Content Fusion to Netlify, you’re ready to create a deliverable.

step.cmd: In Oxygen Content Fusion, click the project name at the top left of the screen to ensure you are outside of your personal workspace.
Select the “Deliverables” tab on the left, then select “new deliverable.” A pop-up will emerge, where you will set up your deliverable.

substep.cmd: Give your deliverable a title, and add a description if you’d like, then use the drop down menu to select the publication you made previously.
Make sure that “automatically trigger build” is selected so that your website updates automatically any time a change is made.
Select the type of deliverable you want to create: “WebHelp” for a website, or “PDF” for a PDF.
Select a template to give the deliverable your desired color palette.
Select “upload output using a publishing connector,” select the connector you made before from the drop-down, and click “save.”

step.cmd: On the deliverable you just made, click “build,” then go to Netlify.

substep.cmd: When you select your project, a link to your website or PDF should be there, which you can follow to see your deliverable.
If you want to, scroll down to “site information” to change the site url from the one automatically generated by Netlify.
